posts.author: blur927
posts.content:
Hi Guys,

Long time lurker first time poster here. I'm trying to build a character for an RP server that has some house rules, and I'm running into trouble. This is also the first server I've played on with a level 40 cap instead of 20, so I'm pretty lost in terms of epic feats and what to do after 20.

The character I want to play is a black flame zealot (http://realmshelps.net/cgi-bin/prestige ... ame_Zealot). I originally thought I'd play a cleric / monk / assassin, but that's a no go due to the multiclassing rules:

Devastating Critical is banned.
Shadowdancer, RDD, Palemaster is banned.
Monks cannot multiclass.
Sorcerer / Paladin and Sorcerer / Blackguard combo is not allowed.

1) PvM or PvP - Builds that are maximized for PvM are often not maximized for dueling with other PCs.

PvM mostly, though there is group based PvP after level 10 or so. I'd prefer to be viable in both. Dueling doesn't really matter.

2) Level cap - What is the maximum level that the build (or server) will likely reach?

40

3) Race preference - Unless a class demands a specific race or races, Human will be assumed. Otherwise, specify the your favorite.

I think human would fit best for the character, but I wouldn't mind other races.

4) Class preference - Describe which class(es) you have been considering so far and why. Your own concept is key to building what will do the job and be the most fun for you to play.

Cleric for sure, I want to try to stay mostly true to the concept. Also maybe asassin or rogue, since I feel like it fits.

5) Melee preference - A few options to consider are: dual-wielding vs. one-hand with shield, high AC dexterity-based vs. high-damage strength-based, sneak attacks (stealth), taunting, specialized attacks (e.g. whirlwind, knockdown, called shots, sneaks, death attacks... you name it!).

Probably DEX based dual wielding, if there's enough feats to go around, but I wouldn't mind having to sword and board it for awhile at low levels.I'd like to have knockdown and maybe some disc to avoid getting knocked down myself if possible.

6) Range preference - DEX archery or Zen Archery (WIS)

Doesn't really matter, I don't plan on being ranged very often.

7) Weapon preference - Which weapon type would you enjoy using the most?

Kukri fits the idea best.

8) Maximum item enhancement - In the setting where you intend to play this character, what is the highest enchantment (or bonus) that is likely to be used on equipment?

I've heard crazy talk of +8 gear being available in really high level areas, but I feel like +5 is going to be what most people have at 40.

9) Spellcasting - If you are requesting a build that is likely to use magic, explain its general use. Will it be used primarily to add enhancements to a physical base attack (i.e. for buffing), to cast strong offensive spells or a balance of both areas of expertise? If arcane-based, would you prefer to be able to cast spells reliably while wearing armor? Is indispellability of buffs an important consideration?

I think spells will mostly be for buffs. I'm not really sure what the AI is like at later levels, but in 1-20 content I've only seen one mob that dispels. In PvP it'll matter more that I can't get dispelled, but it's not critical.

Excited to see what people come up with!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
So, based on what I read, you basically can take the class after 5 levels (Cleric 4/monk 1) as long as you start with Cleric.

What remains is the following questions:

how many levels of the class do you plan to take?

at what level does that class gain a Bonus Feat?

after you start taking that class, can you still take levels in other classes?

Take it EZ!

Edit:

Take a look at these for inspiration: The Shadow Priest, The Divine Dodger

posts.author: blur927
posts.content:
Hi,

Sorry, I should have clarified. The actual Black Flame Zealot class isn't available on the server, I want to emulate it in neverwinter nights, within the multiclassing rules of the server. I want to feel like that class without actually being it, if that makes sense.

Thanks

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Allright. Then take a look at these two builds. Honestly, I prefer the Shadow Priest (not just cuz it's mine, but because HiPS seems like it fits the concept perfectly) and if I were to do the Divine Dodger, I'd build him differently. None have Kukri, but with my build, just get rid of Called Shot for Exotic Weapons and swap a few feats around.

if you want an Assassin, I also have a Cleric / Monk / Assassin.

You should always mention multiclass restrictions to avoid us wasting our time on unusable builds.

Take it EZ!
